column4: is there any one who is good in ubuntu to solve my problem only reply to me if u r good in ubuntu
gnea i have pasted the error over here please check it http://paste.ubuntu.com/75870/
are you sure you're using the right password?
tried with sudo?
so you've been able to use this for awhile then? and it just started doing this recently?
did you setup your .my.cnf for root?
why not do that, then you can just sudo -i and call it without argument?
is it mysql-server-5.0 that you have installed?
excellent.  you can use the zless command in a terminal to read this file: /usr/share/doc/mysql-server-5.0/README.Debian.gz  in it, it explains how to set that up - look for the PASSWORDS section
READ it.
you run this command:  zless /usr/share/doc/mysql-server-5.0/README.Debian.gz    and then you use the down-arrow key to scroll down to the section called PASSWORDS
and then, you read it and follow directions.
i thought you said you had a password set already
then the problem is solved, don't worry about that step :)
are you familiar with phpmyadmin?
you should install it and use it. it is a very nice interface to mysql.
you will find user management to be extremely simplified.
just open firefox and point it at http://localhost/phpmyadmin/
awesome
enjoy :)
very cool.
